name: 朴維鎮
objective: Statistical design of experiments is a wide subject that treats a large number of methods for planning experimental investigations in a manner that ensures statistically valid conclusions. This course introduces students to concepts and techniques of classical and applied experimental design and covers the statistical design of experiments for systematically examining how a system functions. Topics covered will include: introduction to fundamentals and principles of experiments, blocking designs, completely randomized designs (CRD), randomized completely block designs (RCBD), full factorial designs with two levels, fractional designs with two levels, Latin square designs, 3-leval designs (CCD, BBD, Cuboidal designs), and response surface methodologies.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction to fundamentals of engineering statistics and principles of experimentation
Week 2-3 Simple comparative experiments: CRD (Completely randomized design)
Week 4-5 RCBDs (Randomized complete block designs)
Week 6-8 Factorial designs and 2-level factorial designs
Week 9 Midterm or assignment
Week 10-13 2-level fractional factorial design and resolution
Week 14-15 3-level (fractional) factorial designs and multi-factor designs (Latin square design, CCD, BBD, Cuboidal designs)
Week 16-17 Fitting regression model including GLM: Estimation, diagnostics 
Week 18 Final exam or assignment
materials:
Montgomery, D. C. (2017), Design and Analysis of Experiments, 9th Ed., Wiley.
